name: Ruins Of Pachacamac His Holy Temple And Site Museum
description: The Pachacamac Ruins are located about 31 km south of Lima in the Lurin Valley and are very important in the history of Peru. It was a Pre-Inca citadel that was occupied by the Lima culture (200 BC) and Wari, (600 AD). Between the eleventh and fourteenth centuries the Incas came to this region (Culture Ychsma) and built on it the Sun Temple, the Palace of Taurichumbi and The Acllawasi (House of the Chosen).
